data.title: A cuppa Joe, a BLT, and peace.
data.text: On a whim, I stopped by for a coffee; I hadn't been there for awhile, but remembered it as good. It's located on Garden Grove's Historic Main Street, a good place to hang out and talk with the other customers, and the folks walking by. I had a freshly built (and generous-sized) BLT with my coffee, and sat at one of the sidewalk tables. Coffee was good, BLT on multi-grain bread was tasty; a really good morning. Time to go back and try something else; the menu is on line, and makes you hungry just looking at it. Prices are really fair, especially considering the quality and quantity of their food. Great web site, too.
